author: nero_eth
content:
I think stealth addresses are great for use cases where going trough zk verification is just too expensive, gas-wise.
I can very much recommend the cryptonote whitepaper:
https://cryptopapers.info/cryptonote/

It defines unlinkability and untraceability.
Stealth addresses provide unlinkability, which is enough for most use cases (similar to how people are fine with their bank knowing their activity, as long as no one else can see it). That may not be the ideal attitude, but it’s the reality.

If you want full privacy (=untraceability + unlinkability), mixing is unavoidable. It’s the only way to achieve unlinkability. You can add extra layers to make mixers safer for everyday users, but you can’t eliminate the need for on-chain SNARK verification.

Anyone who has used TC or Railway knows it works well for preparing an account with private funds, but it’s not ideal when you need speed and low costs.
